jx.jx_en_mean: (of an estate) occupied by the owner, not by tenants

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: from Old French demeine (later Anglo-Norman French demesne) 'belonging to a lord', from Latin dominicus, from dominus 'lord, master'. Compare domain

means.word_mean: 1. extensive landed property (especially in the country) retained by the owner for his own use;

sentences.sentence: "the family owned a large estate on Long Island"

means.word_mean: 2. territory over which rule or control is exercised;

sentences.sentence: "he made it the law of the land"
